page.title: 06DAIRY FARMING AYMESTREY AREA
page.content: At Covenhope farm there are 120 pedigree{British Friesian}cows with an average yield of 6025 litres @ 3.58% butter fat of milk per lactation and heifers in milk, 5322 litres @ 3.23% B.F. There are also 180 followers comprising in calf heifers,bulling heifers, yearlings and calves. The farm is down to permanent pasture and needing to buy 100 acres of straw from local farmers. This provides roughage for the herd and part of the maintenance diet of the young stock. Wheat straw for bedding and barley straw for feeding. The cows sleep in modern cubicle houses and the young stock on loose straw. The rest of the diet is silage and concentrates (a mixture of barley, wheat, oats and minerals). The herd is milked twice daily in a modern 8-16 herringbone parlour, milk is collected daily.
